result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 10-25-2022

Defendant Lee Donald Lee not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Lee Donald Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status of counsel.  State is in compliance with victim notification.
Defense counsel is awaiting Drug Treatment Court's decision and requests a status conference.
Case remains calendared in Branch 15. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Lee Donald Lee not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Lee Donald Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. State is in compliance with victim notification. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Lee Donald Lee not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Court set a status date.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Lee Donald Lee not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Bailbond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court GRANTED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Pretrial  Conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 8:30am/  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case calendared for a Bailbond Hearing. Defendant in custody and defense counsel in trial in a different court and request an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Any Walgreens in Milwaukee County
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Lee Donald Lee in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Lee Donald Lee in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lee Donald Lee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:
